In 1890, the Illinois Institute of Technology Chicago was born with a big dream – to give folks from all backgrounds an education that would fit right into their times. And you know what? Over 130 years later, they're still rocking it! Rankings from the United States Department of Education College Scorecard show that Illinois Tech is still successful in its mission. Their passion is all about using technology for the greater good. They believe in empowering students from all walks of life with a top-notch technical education and plenty of hands-on experiences. IIT Chicago is all about setting students up for career success and positively impacting the world. Illinois Tech has all sorts of cool programs - engineering, science, architecture, business, design, human sciences, applied technology, and law - you name it! They've got a diverse student community, too, with people from 106 countries.

Illinois Tech stands first in the Chicago Region for Occupational Earnings Power, ranked 22nd in Finance, 32nd in legal writing, and has an impressive upward mobility rate. Plus, they're recognised as one of the country's top 25 best STEM schools. Oh, and did we mention they've got an impressive 92.8% career placement rate? So, it's no surprise that the Higher Learning Commission accredits the Illinois Institute of Technology Chicago. The institute is all about providing world-class education and making a real difference in their student's lives. Go, Illinois Tech!

Chicago is a lively city and a major transportation hub in the Midwest. For international students, the public transportation system in Chicago is well-organised and practical. The Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) runs a fantastic public transportation system, making it one of the most prominent in the US. This ensures students have various safe and comfortable options to explore the city.

When it comes to getting around, students have a range of surface transportation choices. Buses, trains, taxis, limo services, and shuttles are available to help them move around easily and discover new places. Let's break it down:

Bus: The city's extensive bus network, run by the CTA, offers a reliable mode of travel. Bus fares for adults are typically between $1 to $2, depending on the distance covered. The CTA provides a reloadable Ventra Card, allowing smooth transfers between buses and trains. You can take several bus stops, many close to IIT Chicago housing, including State & 33rd Street and State & 32nd Street.

Train: The "L" train system, also managed by the CTA, is an efficient and well-connected mode of transportation. Adult train fares vary based on distance and time, ranging from &$1.77 to $3. Just like with buses, you can also use the Ventra Card for train travel. You can take the 35th St. - Lou Jones and Sox-35th subway station.

Cycling: Chicago is known for being bike-friendly, with plenty of cycling paths and lanes. Students can use the Divvy bike-sharing program, which provides a convenient way to rent bikes for short journeys. A 24-hour pass costs around $11, allowing unlimited 30-minute rides during that period.

Let's discuss the awesome student life at the Illinois Institute of Technology Chicago. It's a fantastic place to be, with so much to offer! First, the student union is like the beating heart of the campus. It's where all the action happens – from fun events and clubs to meeting cool new people. You'll never run out of things to do and friends to make! What makes Illinois Tech stand out is its diverse student community. You've got people from all corners of the globe, each with their own cultures and perspectives. It's like a cultural adventure every day!

Now, when you need a break from all the studying, you've got plenty of chill spots to hang out at. Some cosy coffee shops like Café Connect and Study Brew are where you can grab a cuppa and relax. And if you're a foodie, you'll love the variety of restaurants nearby - Taste of Chicago and Foodie's Paradise are food heaven! Oh, and don't forget the events! There's always something happening – from sports games to cultural festivals. Check out Millennium Park for some awesome concerts and art shows. When you want to unwind, Grant Park is the place to be – a perfect spot to chill and enjoy nature. And if you have hobbies or interests, you can bet there's a club for that! Robotics, entrepreneurship, photography – you name it, they've got it. Joining these clubs is an awesome way to find like-minded folks and have a blast together.

But it's not just about the fun stuff. Illinois Tech takes academics seriously, too. The labs and research opportunities are top-notch, and the faculty is super supportive. They provide the best study environment that prepares you for a successful future.
